comments:
The following NPE seems to be caused by importedSources is NULL when calling 
importedSources.add(source) in some case.  Quick fix of creating a KeyedHashSet 
if NULL seems to solve this.

===
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findDynamicSource
(BundleLoader.java:850)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findSource
(BundleLoader.java:835)
	at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.getPackageSource
(BundleLoader.java:899)
	at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.ExportedPackageImpl.getImportingBundles
(ExportedPackageImpl.java:60)
	at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkCommandProvider._bundle

	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)

What build of Eclipse are you using?  Can you attach the bundle manifest file
(META-INF/MANIFEST.MF) and plugin.xml file you are using for the bundle which 
reproduces this problem?  Are any bundles in your system using DynamicImport-
Package?
Created an attachment (id=23104)
The manifest.mf for the bundle which causes NPE
I am running with the Eclipse 3.1 RC1 build and I have also upload the 
attachment as requested.  Yes, DynamicImport-Package has been used.
A similar issue in bug 105779 has been fixed for 3.1.1.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 105779 ***
